notes: regular -are verb; hard c preserved with h before i/e (cerchi, cerchiamo)
example_sentence_english: I want to look for work.
I am looking for the keys.

notes: spelling with h to keep hard c
example_sentence_english: Do you look for the book?

translation_english: he looks for/she looks for/you (formal) look for

notes: spelling with h to keep hard c

example_sentence_english: I was often looking for that bar.
You were looking for your seat.

translation_english: he was looking for/she was looking for/you (formal) were looking for
example_sentence_english: She was looking for the phone.
We were looking for a restaurant.
I have looked for the documents.
Have you looked for an answer?

translation_english: he has looked for/she has looked for/you (formal) have looked for
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He has looked for the cat.
They have looked for a solution.
